Financial Chart Components

Financial Visualization Components

Line Chart

Line charts are perfect for visualizing time-series financial data such as monthly income/expenses, investment performance over time, or currency exchange rate trends.

Basic Line Chart

Example Code:

<LineChart 
  data={[
    { date: 'Jan', income: 1000, expenses: 800 },
    { date: 'Feb', income: 1200, expenses: 900 },
    // ...more data
  ]} 
  lines={[
    { dataKey: 'income', color: '#4CAF50', name: 'Income' },
    { dataKey: 'expenses', color: '#F44336', name: 'Expenses' },
  ]}
  formatter={(value) => `$${value}`}
/>

Props

NameTypeDescription
dataDataPoint[]Array of data points for the chart (required)
linesLineConfig[]Configuration for each line to display (required)
xAxisDataKeystringThe key for x-axis data (default: 'date')
heightnumber | stringChart height (default: 400)
formatterfunctionFunction to format Y-axis values and tooltips
showGridbooleanWhether to show grid lines (default: true)
showLegendbooleanWhether to show the legend (default: true)
